Description: Lapis lazuli amuletic figure in the form of a lion-headed uraeus standing on a rectangular base, with a suspension ring projecting at the back of the head.
Curator's comments: The lapis lazuli "lion-headed uraeus" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, p. 111, pl. xli, 39.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, p. 111, pl. xli, 39)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.62, p.180, pl.22)
